entry.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
entry.summary: In a recent discussion on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, Agustin Cruz highlighted a crucial distinction between the Ethereum (ETH) and Ethereum Classic (ETC) split and the proposed migration strategy for Bitcoin in relation to post-quantum (PQ) security adjustments. Unlike the ETH/ETC split, where all participants retained an identical number of tokens on both chains and only the DAO hacker faced repercussions, the proposed approach for Bitcoin's PQ migration entails a different scenario. Specifically, this strategy suggests that some Bitcoin holders might lose access to their coins as part of the transition process. This aspect marks a significant departure from previous blockchain adjustments, emphasizing the unique challenges and considerations involved in enhancing Bitcoin's quantum resistance.
